intro: Xantholinum, commonly known as the golden thorn, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and spiny, woody stems. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies. Xantholinum thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sunlight to flourish. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
